intro: Nestoria obtusifoliolata, commonly known as the broad-leafed nestoria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its distinctive, broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in spring. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
